explains: adv. 从文化角度，文化意义上；在人文学方面

sentences.en: Sleep is something that has really been an unexplored topic cross-culturally.
sentences.cn: 在各种文化中，睡眠是一个未被探索的话题。

sentences.en: Thus, class may not be culturally and politically obvious, yet it remains an important part of British society.
sentences.cn: 因此，阶级在文化和政治上可能并不明显，但它仍然是英国社会的重要组成部分。

sentences.en: When going for a drink with friends, a smile and a "cheers" by way of thanks is not only appropriate to the situation, it is also culturally accurate.
sentences.cn: 当和朋友一起喝酒时，一个微笑和一句“cheers”来表示感谢，不仅适合当时的情况，而且从文化上看也是合适的。
